TopicTitle: It takes a cool and collected crew of kerbalnauts to pull this off.

Articles.Content:
I was experimenting with the larger parts and realised i may have something to reach the mun. So i went for it:

considering I had never used the large landing legs, i realised half way to the mun that it would be tricky.

Holy Poop.. Your Lander has got more fuel than my 3crew double Lander...

How did you get that into orbit... Even more how did u land it.. It must behave like a Tanker..

Just wow...

That thing is seriously sexy.

Wow.

I love when I parked my 1m lander next to my 3m lander how much bigger it was. (And the fact that I almost squished a moonwalking Jeb)

Well i forgot to add RCS thrusters to the thing, and the main enjoyment was watching it collapse on itself in the 10-20 iterations that came before it. The support struts (for before liftoff) break off straight away but it wont work without them :\ lol

If i double the solid boosters then i should be able to return to earth methinks.

also, you cant squish them:

(not my image ^)
Also, the lander most likely has less fuel than yours. Take a look at the fuel left
